inclusion.criterion: with RTT (typical or variant) as defined using the internationally agreed 2010 RettSearch criteria.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: genetically defined mutation or deletion of the MECP2 gene.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Girls will have the following prepubertal status: (1) Tanner stage 1 or 2 breast development; (2) Tanner stage 1 or 2 pubic hair development; (3) and younger than 12 years by bone age.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Chronological age must be 2 years or older
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: prior therapeutic use of IGF-1, growth hormone, Lupron® or sex steroids
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: co-morbid or chronic illness beyond that known to be associated with Rett Syndrome:
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: diabetes mellitus, fatty acid oxidation disorder, chromosomal aneuploidy, syndromes associated with high risk of malignancy, current or previous exposure to spinal irradiation or history of malignancy.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: severe scoliosis (defined as a spinal curve of 70 degrees or more as measured on clinical and radiological examination)
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has history of acne, mild hirsutism, elevated testosterone levels, gradual enlargement of hands and feet, irregular menstrual cycle, nipple discharge, snoring, headache, facial features of acromegaly, prognathism. Laboratory evaluation reveals IGF-1 of 968 ng/mL and random GH of 19.7 ng/mL. MRI reveals a macroadenoma with no invasion.
